channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Dead fox hit by car, 13th January
item.description:
A Horrible image of a dead fox body on the way to Tesco express. The fox has been hit by cat on Sunday morning, still lying on the pavement, opposite the AMOT and next to the Tesco express.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 31, Blackheath Road, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Dead animal in the carriageway or footway

item.title: Street light broken on pathway, 12th January
item.description:
One of the lights is broken and has been for months - potential hazard at night and particularly in this weather as seen from the top of the hill in the attached photo. Please can this be sorted post haste

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rock Hill, Dulwich, Greater London

item.title: At least 10000 cigarette ends never cleaned, 12th January
item.description:
It’s an environmental health issue and a danger to health as the cleaner has not picked up or cleaned this area for over one year and the cigarette butts are absolutely excessive and it’s turned into a a vermin and danger hazard

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): De Beauvoir Estate, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The cleaner NEVER picks up litter, 12th January
item.description:
The cleaner has not picked up litter in the green area for about 1year . It’s excessive the amount of rubbish is is attacking vermain. On the other side there are about 10000 cigarette ends that haven’t been cleaned up. Dangerous for young children pets

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): De Beauvoir Estate, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Teenage boy urinated: Clean wall and floor, 12th January
item.description:
Today a teenage boy urinated in the corner (under the covered roof) between the two rows or pram sheds outside Albert Westcott House. Such disgusting behaviour, with its total absence of shame or regard for others' wellbeing or comfort, is now the norm, and I do feel for those who have to clean it up. But please can the floor and wall be cleaned. Those using the sheds will have to step through it. I do so love working hard to pay taxes that have to be spent cleaning up after such degenerates!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Alberta Street, Elephant and Castle, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 52, Langford Place, Longlands, Sidcup, Greater London

item.title: Very intense sensor light on at night, impossible to sleep, 12th January
item.description:
Issue started recently. I assume the light has been installed in good faith but it is disruptively bright and triggers on with every person or car. It is pointed straight at my bedroom and possibly the next door neighbours'. Seems to be 28 Narford Road.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Narford Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Gloucester Ave at the end near Cecil Sharp House, 12th January
item.description:
Both of the no entry signs have been hit by a vehicle and are bent and leaning. The one on the right doesn’t look very secure. They need to both be repaired or replaced.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gloucester Avenue, Chalk Farm, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned Christmas Trees, 12th January
item.description:
Over 20 Christmas trees abandoned on the pavement of Sandbrook Road, they have been moved up and down the pavement but are now blocking access for buggies and wheelchair users. They have been there for nearly two weeks and more are being added each day.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Sandbrook Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 15, Gloucester Avenue, Chalk Farm, Greater London

item.title: Central reservation on pedestrian crossing flooded, 12th January
item.description:
When it rains a large puddle forms on the crossing making it very difficult to get across the road dryly and safely. When it is very cold it freezes into ice and is very dangerous indeed.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 65, Half Moon Lane, Dulwich Village, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street light STILL not fixed, 12th January
item.description:
First reported light not working back in October 25 .. was advised FIXED on 7/11 which it wasnt so reported again and once again advised FIXED but it is still not working … ITS PITCH BLACK !!!!! AND DANGEROUS

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 53, Ellison Road, Longlands, Sidcup, Greater London
